TopicTitle: [Development thread] Launchers Pack (Working on RSS-compatible Delta II)

Articles.Content:
[ imgur ]e4U8E[ /imgur ]

Just remove all the space. Than it should be visible

Hi, it is time for a progress update I think:)

In the last days I experimented a bit with the R-7, I am not too happy about the result, I have to improve it in a lot aspects... So loads of work is waiting for me...

But I also worked on a Complete redesign of my Delta II, it is now even better I think. And: It will be RSS compatible. So that means you can replicate a real launch 1:1 in KSP:cool: I made the rocket 1:1 scaled, so for those of you who don`t play with RSS I will scale the rocket to 64%. I got everything worked, just the fairings not. I sucked in modelling, everytime when I tried to get them working they were a) invisibe in Unity or they didn`t worked in Blender itself. And I just don`t get how I did the old Fairings...(which don`t fit to my new model anymore). Just a picture here to show you what I mean:

And I just don`t get it working as I want...

Anyway, here are some images to see what I have done already. Feedback would be nice, thanks,

Kartoffelkuchen:cool:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Engine nozzle shouldn't be red. It's just pre-launch covering, it's not that color once it flies. In fact, there should be nothing red on the rocket after it takes off, all reds are meant to be removed before flight (except the writing/flags of course).
Thank you very much Darth Trololo!
Anyone interested in a WIP release for the next 48h of forum downtime (Still the downtime hasn't started..)? (It is still without fairings..)
